<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="1">
	(1)
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="1">
	This prospectus relates to shares of Class&nbsp;A common stock, par value $0.01 per share, and Class B common stock, par value $0.01 per share, of Hyster-Yale Materials
	Handling, Inc. (&#147;Hyster-Yale&#148;) which will be distributed pursuant to a spin-off transaction to the holders of Class&nbsp;A common stock, par value $1.00 per share, and Class B common stock, par value $1.00 per share, of NACCO Industries,
	Inc. (&#147;NACCO&#148;). The amount of Hyster-Yale Class&nbsp;A common stock (&#147;Hyster-Yale Class&nbsp;A Common&#148;) and Hyster-Yale Class B common stock (&#147;Hyster-Yale Class B Common&#148;) to be registered represents the maximum number
	of shares of Hyster-Yale Class&nbsp;A Common and Hyster-Yale Class B Common, respectively, that will be distributed to the holders of NACCO Class&nbsp;A common stock (&#147;NACCO Class&nbsp;A Common&#148;) and NACCO Class B common stock (&#147;NACCO
	Class B Common&#148;) upon consummation of the spin-off. One share of Hyster-Yale Class&nbsp;A Common and one share of Hyster-Yale Class B Common will be distributed for each share of NACCO Class&nbsp;A Common outstanding on the record date of the
	spin-off and one share of Hyster-Yale Class&nbsp;A Common and one share of Hyster-Yale Class B Common will be distributed for each share of NACCO Class B Common outstanding on the record date of the spin-off. Because it is not possible to accurately
	state the number of shares of NACCO Class&nbsp;A Common and NACCO Class B Common that will be outstanding as of the record date of the spin-off, this calculation is based on the shares of NACCO Class&nbsp;A Common and the shares of NACCO Class B
	Common outstanding as of August 8, 2012.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>

	Table of Contents

</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2" COLOR="#CC062A">
	The information in this prospectus is not complete and may be changed. We may not distribute
	these securities until the registration statement filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission is effective. This prospectus is not an offer to sell securities, and it is not soliciting an offer to buy these securities, in any state where the
	offer or sale is not permitted.
</FONT>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="3">
<B>
	PROSPECTUS
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
</EFX_REGISTRATION_FEE>
<EFX_SUBJECT_STOCK_INFO>
<A NAME="FIS_SUBJECT_STOCK_INFO"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	SUBJECT TO COMPLETION, DATED SEPTEMBER 26, 2012
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="3">
<B>
	8,389,563 Shares of Class&nbsp;A Common Stock
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="3">
<B>
	8,389,563 Shares of Class
	B Common Stock
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="6">
<B>
	Hyster-Yale Materials Handling, Inc.
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2" COLOR="#CC062A">
<B>
	PRELIMINARY COPY
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	To the Stockholders of NACCO Industries, Inc.:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:7%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	We are pleased
	to inform you that the board of directors of NACCO Industries, Inc. (&#147;NACCO&#148;) has approved the spin-off of Hyster-Yale Materials Handling, Inc. (&#147;Hyster-Yale&#148;) to NACCO stockholders. Hyster-Yale designs, engineers, manufactures,
	sells and services a comprehensive line of lift trucks and aftermarket parts marketed globally primarily under the
	Hyster
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="1">
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE; POSITION:RELATIVE; BOTTOM:.8EX">
	&reg;
</SUP>
</FONT>
	and Yale
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="1">
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE; POSITION:RELATIVE; BOTTOM:.8EX">
	&reg;
</SUP>
</FONT>
	brand names. Immediately following the spin-off, Hyster-Yale will be an independent public company.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:7%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	To effect the spin-off, NACCO will make a distribution of all of the outstanding shares of Hyster-Yale common stock to holders of NACCO
	common stock as of 5:00 p.m., Eastern Time, on September 25, 2012, the record date for the spin-off. NACCO will distribute one share of Hyster-Yale Class&nbsp;A common stock, referred to as Hyster-Yale Class&nbsp;A Common or our Class&nbsp;A Common,
	and one share of Hyster-Yale Class B common stock, referred to as Hyster-Yale Class B Common or our Class B Common, for each share of NACCO common stock, whether NACCO Class&nbsp;A common stock, referred to as NACCO Class&nbsp;A Common or NACCO
	Class B common stock, referred to as NACCO Class B Common. The spin-off is expected to occur after the close of trading on September&nbsp;28, 2012. Hyster-Yale Class&nbsp;A Common has been approved for listing on the NYSE under the symbol
	&#147;HY.&#148; The Hyster-Yale Class B Common will not be listed on the NYSE or any other stock exchange and is subject to substantial restrictions on transfer. Each share of Hyster-Yale Class&nbsp;A Common is entitled to one vote per share on
	matters submitted to a vote of the Hyster-Yale common stockholders. Each share of Hyster-Yale Class B Common is entitled to ten votes per share on matters submitted to a vote of the Hyster-Yale common stockholders, is subject to transfer
	restrictions and is convertible into one share of Hyster-Yale Class&nbsp;A Common at any time without cost at the option of the holder.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:7%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	After the spin-off, NACCO will continue to own and operate its three other principal businesses, which are mining (The North American Coal Corporation), small appliances (Hamilton Beach Brands, Inc.) and
	specialty retailing (The Kitchen Collection, LLC).
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:7%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	No vote of NACCO stockholders is required in connection with this spin-off.
	NACCO stockholders will not be required to pay any consideration for the shares of Hyster-Yale common stock they receive in the spin-off, and they will not be required to surrender or exchange shares of their NACCO common stock or take any other
	action in connection with the spin-off. We expect that, for U.S. federal income tax purposes, the spin-off will be tax-free to you, except with respect to cash received in lieu of fractional shares of Hyster-Yale common stock.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:7%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Because NACCO owns all of the outstanding shares of Hyster-Yale&#146;s common stock, there currently is no public trading market for
	Hyster-Yale common stock. We anticipate that a limited market, commonly known as a &#147;when-issued&#148; trading market, for Hyster-Yale&#146;s Class&nbsp;A Common will develop on or shortly before the record date for the spin-off and will
	continue up to and including the spin-off date. We expect the &#147;regular-way&#148; trading of Hyster-Yale&#146;s Class&nbsp;A Common will begin on the first trading day following the spin-off date.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<CENTER>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:6PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:2PX;BORDER-BOTTOM:0.5PT SOLID #000000;WIDTH:23%">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</CENTER>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:7%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	In reviewing this prospectus, you should carefully consider the matters described in
	&#147;
<A HREF="#D371112DS1A_HTM_TOC371112_4">
	Risk&nbsp;Factors
</A>
	&#148; beginning on page 15 of this prospectus.
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:7%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Neither the
	Securities and Exchange Commission nor any state securities commission has approved or disapproved of these securities or determined whether this prospectus is truthful or complete. Any representation to the contrary is a criminal offense.
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:7%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	This prospectus does not constitute an offer to sell or the solicitation of an offer to buy any securities.
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;

</TD>
<TD NOWRAP VALIGN="BOTTOM" ALIGN="RIGHT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	A-1
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD NOWRAP VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:1.00EM; TEXT-INDENT:-1.00EM">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<A HREF="#D371112DS1A_HTM_TOC371112_22">
	Amended and Restated Bylaws of Hyster-Yale
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD NOWRAP VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD NOWRAP VALIGN="BOTTOM" ALIGN="RIGHT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	B-1
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD NOWRAP VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:7%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	This prospectus is being furnished solely to provide information to NACCO stockholders who will
	receive shares of Hyster-Yale common stock in the spin-off. It is not and is not to be construed as an inducement or encouragement to buy or sell any securities of NACCO or Hyster-Yale. This prospectus describes Hyster-Yale&#146;s business, its
	relationship with NACCO and how the spin-off affects NACCO and its stockholders, and provides other information to assist you in evaluating the benefits and risks of holding or disposing of the common stock that you will receive in the spin-off.
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:7%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	You should not assume that the information contained in this prospectus is accurate as of any date other than the date
	set forth on the cover. Changes to the information contained in this prospectus may occur after that date, and we undertake no obligation to update the information, except in the normal course of our public disclosure obligations.
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage4"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D371112DS1A_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
<A NAME="D371112DS1A_HTM_TOC371112_1">
</A>
	QUESTIONS AND ANSWERS ABOUT THE SPIN-OFF
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:7%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<I>
	The following questions and answers briefly address some commonly asked questions about the spin-off. They may not include all the
	information that is important to you. We encourage you to read carefully this entire prospectus, including the annexes and the other documents to which we have referred you. We have included page references in certain parts of this section to direct
	you to a more detailed discussion of each topic presented in this section. Unless the context indicates otherwise, &#147;Hyster-Yale,&#148; &#147;we,&#148; &#147;us&#148; and &#147;our&#148; refer to Hyster-Yale Materials Handling, Inc. and its
	subsidiaries before the spin-off and after the spin-off, as applicable. &#147;NACCO&#148; refers to NACCO Industries, Inc., unless the context clearly indicates otherwise, not its subsidiaries.
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
<I>
	What will NACCO stockholders receive in the spin-off?
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:7%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	To effect the spin-off, NACCO will make a distribution of all of the outstanding shares of Hyster-Yale common stock to NACCO common stockholders as of the record date, which will be September 25, 2012.
	For each share of NACCO Class&nbsp;A Common held on the record date, NACCO will distribute one share of Hyster-Yale Class&nbsp;A Common and one share of Hyster-Yale Class B Common. Similarly, for each share of NACCO Class B Common held on the record
	date, NACCO will distribute one share of Hyster-Yale Class&nbsp;A Common and one share of Hyster-Yale Class B Common.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:7%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	No
	fractional shares of our Class&nbsp;A Common or our Class B Common will be distributed in the spin-off. Instead, as soon as practicable after the spin-off, the transfer agent will convert the fractional shares of our Class B Common into an equal
	number of fractional shares of our Class&nbsp;A Common, aggregate all fractional shares of our Class&nbsp;A Common into whole shares of our Class&nbsp;A Common, sell these shares of our Class&nbsp;A Common in the open market at prevailing market
	prices and distribute the applicable portion of the aggregate net cash proceeds of these sales to each holder who otherwise would have been entitled to receive a fractional share in the spin-off. You will not be entitled to any interest on the
	amount of the cash payment made in lieu of fractional shares.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:7%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	NACCO stockholders will not be required to pay for shares of
	our common stock received in the spin-off, or to surrender or exchange shares of NACCO common stock or take any other action to be entitled to receive our common stock. The distribution of our common stock will not cancel or affect the number of
	outstanding shares of NACCO common stock. Accordingly, NACCO stockholders should retain any NACCO stock certificates they hold.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:7%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Immediately after the spin-off, holders of NACCO common stock as of the record date will hold all of the outstanding shares of our Class&nbsp;A Common and our Class B Common. Based on the number of shares
	of NACCO common stock outstanding on September 25, 2012, NACCO will distribute 8,389,563 shares of our Class&nbsp;A Common and 8,389,563 shares of our Class B Common to NACCO stockholders in the spin-off (page 25).
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
<I>
	Why is NACCO spinning off Hyster-Yale?
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:7%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	NACCO is a holding company that owns businesses in four separate business segments: lift trucks (Hyster-Yale), mining (The North American Coal Corporation), small appliances (Hamilton Beach Brands, Inc.)
	and specialty retailing (The Kitchen Collection, LLC). NACCO&#146;s board of directors, which is referred to as the NACCO board, determined that separating its lift trucks business from NACCO&#146;s other businesses through the spin-off of
	Hyster-Yale is in the best interests of NACCO and its stockholders and has concluded that the separation will provide each company with a number of significant opportunities and benefits, including:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	&#149;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<I>
	Create Opportunities for Growth
</I>
	. Create greater flexibility for Hyster-Yale to pursue strategic growth opportunities, such as acquisitions and
	joint ventures, in the materials handling industry because it will have the ability to offer its stock as consideration in connection with potential future acquisitions or other growth opportunities.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	1
</FONT>
</P>

<TD WIDTH="7%">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	&#149;

</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<I>
	Management Focus.
</I>
	Reinforce management&#146;s focus on serving each of Hyster-Yale&#146;s market segments and customer application needs, and on
	responding flexibly to changing market conditions and growth markets.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	&#149;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<I>
	Access to Capital and Capital Structure.
</I>
	Provide Hyster-Yale with direct access to equity capital markets and greater access to debt capital
	markets to fund its growth strategies and to establish a capital structure and dividend policy reflecting its business needs and financial position.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	&#149;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<I>
	Recruiting and Retaining Employees.
</I>
	Strengthen the alignment of senior management incentives with the needs and performance of the Company
	through the use of equity compensation arrangements that will also improve our ability to attract, retain and motivate qualified personnel.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	&#149;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<I>
	Investor Choice.
</I>
	Provide investors with a focused investment option in the materials handling business that offers different investment and
	business characteristics, including different opportunities for growth, capital structure, business models and financial returns. This will allow investors to evaluate the separate merits, performance and future prospects of Hyster-Yale and NACCO.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:7%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	The NACCO board also considered the following factors, among others, in connection with its decision to
	spin-off Hyster-Yale:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	&#149;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<I>
	Proportionate Interest.
</I>
	As a result of the equal distribution of dividends to both classes of NACCO common stock required by NACCO&#146;s
	Restated Certificate of Incorporation, which is referred to as the NACCO Charter, following the spin-off, the interest of NACCO stockholders in Hyster-Yale will differ from the interest those stockholders currently have in NACCO. In particular, the
	collective voting power in Hyster-Yale of holders of NACCO Class A Common will increase by approximately 51% while the collective voting power in Hyster-Yale of holders of NACCO Class B Common will decrease by approximately 51%.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	&#149;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<I>
	Certain Restrictions Relating to Tax-Free Distributions
</I>
	. The ability of Hyster-Yale to engage in significant equity transactions could be
	limited or restricted for a period of time after the spin-off in order to preserve the tax-free nature of the spin-off. See &#147;Risk Factors &#150; We might not be able to engage in desirable strategic transactions and equity issuances following
	the spin-off because of certain restrictions relating to requirements for tax-free distributions.&#148;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	&#149;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<I>
	No Existing Public Market
</I>
	. There is no existing public market for our common stock and the combined market values of NACCO common stock and our
	common stock following the spin-off may be less than the value of NACCO common stock prior to the spin-off; and
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	&#149;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<I>
	Risks Factors.
</I>
	Certain other risks associated with the spin-off and our business after the spin-off, as described in this prospectus under the
	heading &#147;Risk Factors&#148; beginning on Page 15.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
<I>
	What businesses will NACCO engage in after the spin-off?
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:7%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	NACCO will continue to be a holding company that engages in three principal businesses after the spin-off: mining,
	small appliances and specialty retailing.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
<I>
	Why does Hyster-Yale have two classes of common stock?
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:7%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	NACCO has two classes of common stock. The spin-off of Hyster-Yale from NACCO is structured to provide the Hyster-Yale stockholders with
	substantially the same capital structure that currently exists for the NACCO stockholders, with certain changes intended to provide Hyster-Yale, as an independent company, with additional flexibility, including the ability to issue blank check
	preferred shares and an increased number of authorized shares. In the event blank check preferred stock is issued in the future, the voting rights and other rights of holders of our common stock may be adversely affected. In addition, while the
	governance-related provisions of Hyster-Yale&#146;s amended and restated certificate of incorporation and amended and restated bylaws,
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	2
</FONT>
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage6"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D371112DS1A_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	as well as a stockholders&#146; agreement to which Hyster-Yale will be a party, are substantially the same as NACCO&#146;s governance-related provisions and stockholders&#146; agreement, there
	are certain changes from the corresponding NACCO provisions, including that holders of Hyster-Yale Class B Common are permitted to transfer their shares to certain limited liability companies in addition to certain trusts and corporations. In
	addition, holders of NACCO Class B Common currently have the ability to transfer their shares to certain relatives of the spouse of such holders and holders of our Class B Common do not have that right. With respect to distribution of the stock of
	any subsidiary of Hyster-Yale, Hyster-Yale&#146;s amended and restated certificate of incorporation will permit the Company to elect to distribute to each holder of Hyster-Yale Class A Common shares of the Class A common stock of such subsidiary and
	to each holder of Hyster-Yale&#146;s Class B Common shares of the Class B common stock of such subsidiary, which is not permitted under the NACCO restated certificate of incorporation. Our amended and restated bylaws contain additional procedures
	for the nomination and election of directors of Hyster-Yale. The 80% vote requirement to amend certain provisions of our amended and restated bylaws was also expanded to apply to amendments to provisions regarding the order of business at meetings
	of stockholders and nominations and election of directors. Although the NACCO restated certificate of incorporation requires the affirmative vote of 50% of the outstanding voting stock of NACCO for the removal of directors, our amended and restated
	certificate of incorporation provides for the removal of directors with or without cause by an 80% vote of our stockholders. Finally, our amended and restated certificate of incorporation contains an 80% vote requirement to amend certain provisions
	of our amended and restated certificate of incorporation with respect to the election and removal of directors, amendment of bylaws and rights to indemnification, which is not in the NACCO restated certificate of incorporation. Hyster-Yale&#146;s
	amended and restated certificate of incorporation, amended and restated bylaws and stockholders&#146; agreement are described in more detail in &#147;Ancillary Agreements &#150; Stockholders&#146; Agreement&#148; and &#147;Description of Capital
	Stock of Hyster-Yale after the Spin-off.&#148;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
<I>
	Why will I receive Hyster-Yale Class A Common and Hyster-Yale Class B Common if I
	currently own only NACCO Class A Common or NACCO Class B Common?
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:7%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	The NACCO Charter provides that each share of NACCO
	Class A Common and NACCO Class B Common is equal in respect of rights to dividends and any other distribution in cash, stock or property. Therefore, pursuant to the terms of the NACCO Charter, NACCO is required to distribute one share of Hyster-Yale
	Class A Common and one share of Hyster-Yale Class B Common for each share of NACCO common stock, whether NACCO Class A Common or NACCO Class B Common. As a result of this requirement for equal distribution, the proportionate interest that NACCO
	stockholders will have in Hyster-Yale following the spin-off will differ from the interest those stockholders currently have in NACCO. In particular, the collective voting power in Hyster-Yale of holders of NACCO Class A Common will increase by
	approximately 51% while the collective voting power in Hyster-Yale of holders of NACCO Class B Common will decrease by approximately 51%. See &#147;Risk Factors &#150; The relative voting power of holders of our Class B Common who convert their
	shares of our Class B Common into Class A Common will diminish&#148; and &#147;Risk Factors &#150; The relative voting power of the remaining holders of Class B Common will increase as holders of our Class B Common convert their shares of our Class
	B Common into shares of our Class A Common.&#148;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
<I>
	Who is entitled to receive shares of our common stock in the spin-off?
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:7%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Holders of NACCO common stock at the close of business on September 25, 2012, the record date for the spin-off, will
	be entitled to receive shares of our common stock in the spin-off.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
<I>
	When is the spin-off expected to be completed?
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:7%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	The spin-off is expected to be completed during the third quarter of 2012.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
<I>
	What do I need to do to receive my shares of Hyster-Yale common stock?
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:7%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	You do not need to take any action to receive your shares of our common stock. The shares of our common stock will be distributed on the date of the spin-off to holders of NACCO common stock as of the
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	3
</FONT>
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage7"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D371112DS1A_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	record date for the spin-off in book-entry form in accordance with Section&nbsp;170 of the General Corporation Law of the State of Delaware (the &#147;DGCL&#148;).
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
<I>
	What if I want to receive certificates representing my shares of Hyster-Yale common stock?
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:7%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	While the shares of our common stock will be distributed in book-entry form, you may request to receive certificates representing your
	shares of our common stock from our transfer agent.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
<I>
	What will govern my rights as a Hyster-Yale stockholder?
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:7%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Your rights as a Hyster-Yale stockholder will be governed by Delaware law, as well as our amended and restated certificate of
	incorporation and our amended and restated bylaws. A description of these rights is included in this prospectus under the heading &#147;Description of Capital Stock of Hyster-Yale after the Spin-Off&#148; (page 146). Our amended and restated
	certificate of incorporation is attached to this prospectus as
<I>
	Annex A
</I>
	, and our amended and restated bylaws are attached to this prospectus as
<I>
	Annex B
</I>
	. These documents are substantially comparable to NACCO&#146;s constituent documents.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
<I>
	What if I want to convert or sell the shares of Hyster-Yale Class B Common I receive in the spin-off?
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:7%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Like the NACCO Class B Common, our Class B Common will not be listed on the NYSE or any other stock exchange, and we do not expect any
	trading market for our Class B Common to exist. In addition, our Class&nbsp;B Common generally will not be transferable except to or among a limited number of permitted transferees pursuant to our amended and restated certificate of incorporation.
	The violation of these transfer restrictions will cause our Class B Common to convert automatically into Class&nbsp;A Common, as described in more detail in &#147;Description of Capital Stock of Hyster-Yale after the Spin-Off &#151; Common Stock
	&#151; Restrictions on Transfer of Class B Common; Convertibility of Class B Common into Class&nbsp;A Common&#148; beginning on page 146. However, our Class B Common will be convertible at any time, without cost to you, into our Class&nbsp;A Common
	on a share-for-share basis. If you want to sell the equity interest represented by your shares of our Class B Common, you may convert those shares into an equal number of shares of our Class&nbsp;A Common at any time, without cost, and then sell
	your shares of our Class&nbsp;A Common in the public market.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:7%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	You will receive a conversion form when you receive the
	shares of our Class B Common that you are entitled to receive in the spin-off. The conversion form will include instructions for converting shares of our Class B Common into an equal number of shares of our Class&nbsp;A Common. If you elect to
	convert your shares of our Class B Common into shares of our Class&nbsp;A Common, you should follow the instructions included with the form, complete, sign and date the form, and return the form, along with your certificate, if any, representing
	shares of our Class B Common, to our transfer agent. If you deliver a certificate, our transfer agent, as promptly as practicable after receipt of your completed, signed and dated form and certificate, will issue to you a certificate representing
	shares of our Class&nbsp;A Common equal to the number of shares of our Class B Common that you elected to convert. Any Class&nbsp;A Common issued upon conversion of Class B Common will be issued in the name or names you specified in the form. The
	conversion will be deemed to have been made immediately prior to the close of business on the date you surrendered your completed, signed and dated form and certificate, if any. After you receive shares of our Class&nbsp;A Common you may sell those
	shares in the public market. After you convert our Class B Common into our Class&nbsp;A Common, such shares may not be converted back into shares of our Class B Common.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
<I>
	Do I have to convert my shares of Class B Common before I sell them?
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:7%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	No. If you do not wish to complete the conversion process before you sell, you may effect a sale of our Class&nbsp;A Common into which
	your shares of our Class B Common is convertible. If you hold certificated Class B Common simply deliver the certificate or certificates representing such shares of our Class B Common to a broker, properly endorsed, in contemplation of the sale. The
	broker will then instruct the transfer agent to convert such Class B Common and, if necessary, present a certificate or certificates representing shares of our Class B
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	4
</FONT>
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage8"></A>

<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D371112DS1A_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Common to our transfer agent, who will issue to the purchaser a certificate, if necessary, representing the number of shares of our Class&nbsp;A Common sold in settlement of the transaction.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
<I>
	Are there risks associated with the spin-off and our business after the spin-off?
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:7%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Yes. You should carefully review the risks described in this prospectus under the heading &#147;Risk Factors&#148; beginning on page 15.
</FONT>
</P>

</I>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:7%">

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">

	Our shares of Class&nbsp;A Common have been approved for listing on the New York Stock Exchange under the symbol &#147;HY.&#148; Our Class B Common will not be listed on the NYSE or any other stock
	exchange.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
<I>
	Where can I find more information about Hyster-Yale and NACCO?
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:7%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	You can find more information about NACCO and us from various sources described under &#147;Where You Can Find More Information&#148;
	beginning on page 151.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
<I>
	What are the U.S. federal income tax consequences of the spin-off to NACCO stockholders?
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:7%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	NACCO has received an opinion of counsel to the effect that, for U.S. federal income tax purposes, the
	contribution of assets to Hyster-Yale by NACCO and the assumption of liabilities of NACCO by Hyster-Yale (the &#147;Contribution&#148;) together with the spin-off will qualify as a reorganization under Section&nbsp;368(a)(1)(D) of the Internal
	Revenue Code (the &#147;Code&#148;), and the spin-off will qualify as tax-free under Sections 355 and 361 of the Code, except for cash received in lieu of fractional shares. The opinion relies on certain facts and assumptions, and certain
	representations and undertakings, provided by NACCO and us regarding the past and future conduct of our respective businesses and other matters.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:7%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Because the Contribution and the spin-off will qualify under Sections 355 and 361 of the Code, for U.S. federal income tax purposes, no gain or loss will be recognized by us in connection with the
	Contribution and spin-off, no gain or loss will be recognized by a NACCO stockholder and no amount will be included in the income of a stockholder, upon the receipt of our common stock in the spin-off. A NACCO stockholder will recognize gain or loss
	with respect to any cash received in lieu of a fractional share. See &#147;Material U.S. Federal Income Tax Consequences&#148; beginning on page 32.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:7%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Each NACCO stockholder is urged to consult a tax advisor as to the specific tax consequences of the spin-off to that stockholder, including the effect of any state, local, or non-U.S. tax laws and any
	changes in applicable tax laws.
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	5
</FONT>
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage9"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D371112DS1A_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
<I>
	How will I determine the tax basis I will have in the shares of Hyster-Yale Class&nbsp;A and Class B
	common stock I receive in the spin-off?
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:7%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Generally, for U.S. federal income tax purposes, your aggregate basis in
	the stock you hold in NACCO and the Hyster-Yale common stock received in the spin-off (including cash received in lieu of fractional shares) will equal the aggregate basis of NACCO common stock held by you immediately before the spin-off. This
	aggregate basis will be allocated among your NACCO common stock and the Hyster-Yale common stock you receive in the spin-off (including any fractional share interests in Hyster-Yale for which cash is received) in proportion to the relative fair
	market value of each immediately following the spin-off. See &#147;Material U.S. Federal Income Tax Consequences&#148; beginning on page 32.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:7%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	You should consult your tax advisor about how this allocation will work in your situation (including a situation where you have purchased or received NACCO shares at different times or for different
	amounts) and regarding any particular consequences of the spin-off to you, including the application of state, local and non-U.S. tax laws.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	6

<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
<A NAME="D371112DS1A_HTM_TOC371112_2">
</A>
	SUMMARY
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:7%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<I>
	This summary of the information contained in this prospectus may not include all the information that is important to you. To
	understand fully and for a more complete description of the terms and conditions of the spin-off, you should read this prospectus, including the annexes, in its entirety and the documents to which you are referred. See &#147;Where You Can Find More
	Information&#148; (page 151). Page references have been included parenthetically to direct you to a more complete discussion of each topic presented in this summary.
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Information About Hyster-Yale (page 58)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:7%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Hyster-Yale
	is a Delaware corporation and a wholly owned subsidiary of NACCO. We design, engineer, manufacture, sell and service a comprehensive line of lift trucks and aftermarket parts marketed globally. Our well-known brands include Hyster
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="1">
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE; POSITION:RELATIVE; BOTTOM:.8EX">
	&reg;
</SUP>
</FONT>
	and Yale
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="1">
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE; POSITION:RELATIVE; BOTTOM:.8EX">
	&reg;
</SUP>
</FONT>
	. For more information about our business, including our competitive strengths, see &#147;Business of Hyster-Yale&#148; beginning on page 58.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Hyster-Yale Materials Handling, Inc.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	5875 Landerbrook Drive
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Cleveland, Ohio 44124
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	(440)&nbsp;449-9600
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Information about NACCO
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:7%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	NACCO is a holding company that will continue to have three principal businesses after the spin-off: mining, small appliances and specialty retailing. The North American Coal Corporation (&#147;NA
	Coal&#148;) mines and markets coal primarily as fuel for power generation and provides selected value-added mining services for other natural resources companies. Hamilton Beach Brands, Inc. (&#147;HBB&#148;) is a leading designer, marketer and
	distributor of small electric household appliances, as well as commercial products for restaurants, bars and hotels. The Kitchen Collection, LLC (&#147;KC&#148;) is a national specialty retailer of kitchenware and gourmet foods operating under the
	Kitchen Collection
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="1">

	&reg;
</SUP>
</FONT>
	and Le Gourmet Chef
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="1">

	&reg;
</SUP>
</FONT>
	store names in outlet and traditional malls throughout the United States.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	NACCO Industries, Inc.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	The Spin-Off (page 141)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:7%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	On September 12, 2012, the NACCO board of directors and the Hyster-Yale board of directors, which is referred to as our Board, each
	approved the spin-off of Hyster-Yale, upon the terms and subject to the conditions contained in the separation agreement between NACCO and us, which is referred to as the separation agreement. For a more detailed description of the terms of the
	separation agreement, see &#147;The Separation Agreement&#148; beginning on page 141.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:7%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	We encourage you to read the
	separation agreement, which is filed as an exhibit to the registration statement that contains this prospectus, because it sets forth the terms of the spin-off.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Stock Ownership of Hyster-Yale Directors and Executive Officers (page 66)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:7%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	The stock ownership of our directors and executive officers immediately after the spin-off is described under the heading &#147;Security
	Ownership of Certain Beneficial Owners and Management&#148; beginning on page 66.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	7
</FONT>
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage11"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D371112DS1A_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<DIV STYLE ="BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT SOLID #000000;BORDER-LEFT:1PT SOLID #000000;BORDER-RIGHT:1PT SOLID #000000;BORDER-TOP:1PT SOLID #000000;MARGIN-LEFT:0PX;MARGIN-RIGHT:0PX;WIDTH:100%">
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:97%; MARGIN-TOP:1.5%; MARGIN-LEFT:1.5%; MARGIN-RIGHT:-1.25%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Ownership of Hyster-Yale after the Spin-Off (page 27)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:7%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Immediately after the spin-off, NACCO stockholders as of the record date will hold all of the outstanding shares of our Class&nbsp;A
	Common and our Class B Common. Based on the number of shares of NACCO common stock outstanding on September&nbsp;25, 2012, NACCO will distribute 8,389,563 shares of our Class&nbsp;A Common and 8,389,563 shares of our Class B Common in the spin-off.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Operations of Hyster-Yale after the Spin-Off (page&nbsp;27)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:7%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	We will continue to conduct business after completion of the spin-off under multiple brands and trade names. Our headquarters will
	continue to be located in Cleveland, Ohio.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Management of Hyster-Yale after the Spin-Off (page&nbsp;27)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:7%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	After the spin-off, our executive officers will be substantially the same as our executive officers immediately before the spin-off and
	will remain in office until their respective successors are duly elected or appointed and qualified in accordance with our amended and restated certificate of incorporation and our amended and restated bylaws or as otherwise provided by law.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:7%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	After the spin-off, we will be led by:
</FONT>
</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Hyster-Yale Board after the Spin-Off (page&nbsp;27)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:7%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	After the
	spin-off, our Board will consist of Alfred M. Rankin, Jr., J.C. Butler, Jr., Carolyn Corvi, John P. Jumper, Dennis W. LaBarre, Michael E. Shannon, Britton T. Taplin, Claiborne Rankin and Eugene Wong, who will remain in office until their respective
	successors are duly elected or appointed and qualified in accordance with our amended and restated certificate of incorporation and our amended and restated bylaws or as otherwise provided by law. Of these individuals, the following served as our
	directors prior to the spin-off: Alfred M. Rankin, Jr., John P. Jumper, Dennis W. LaBarre, Michael E. Shannon, Britton T. Taplin and Eugene Wong.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Committees of the Hyster-Yale Board after the Spin-Off (page&nbsp;28)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:7%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	After the spin-off, our Board will have an audit review committee, a compensation committee, a nominating and corporate governance
	committee and a finance committee. Our Board has determined that Carolyn Corvi, John P. Jumper, Dennis W. LaBarre, Michael E. Shannon, Britton T. Taplin and Eugene Wong satisfy the criteria for director independence as set forth in the NYSE rules.
</FONT>
</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Interests of NACCO and Hyster-Yale Directors
	and Executive Officers in the Spin-Off (page&nbsp;28)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:7%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Some NACCO and Hyster-Yale directors and executive officers
	have interests in the spin-off that are different from, or in addition to, the interests of NACCO stockholders who will receive shares of our common stock in the spin-off. The NACCO board and our Board were aware of these interests and considered
	them in making their respective decisions to approve the separation agreement. These interests include:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">

	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	&#149;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	the designation of certain of our directors and officers before the spin-off as our directors or executive officers after the spin-off, including some
	who will serve as directors or executive officers of both Hyster-Yale and NACCO;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">

	and certain members of the Rankin and Taplin families with respect to ownership of our common stock, as described in more detail in &#147;Security Ownership of Certain Beneficial Owners and Management&#148; beginning on page 66 and &#147;Ancillary
	Agreements &#151; Stockholders&#146; Agreement&#148; beginning on page 145;
