<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D371112DS1A_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
<A NAME="D371112DS1A_HTM_TOC371112_6">
</A>
	THE SPIN-OFF
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<I>
	The discussion in this prospectus of the spin-off and the principal terms of the separation agreement is subject to, and qualified by reference to,
	the separation agreement which is filed as an exhibit to the registration statement that contains this prospectus and is incorporated by reference into this prospectus.
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	General
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:7%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	On September 12, 2012, the NACCO board and our Board each
	approved the separation agreement.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Manner of Effecting the Spin-Off
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:7%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	All of our common stock outstanding, which is currently 100 shares, is owned by NACCO. Before the spin-off, those shares will be
	converted into the number of shares of our Class&nbsp;A Common and our Class B Common required to effect the spin-off. To effect the spin-off, NACCO will make a distribution of all of the outstanding shares of our Class&nbsp;A Common and Class B
	Common to holders of NACCO common stock as of the record date for the spin-off. The record date for the spin-off is September 25 , 2012.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:7%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	The NACCO Charter provides that each share of NACCO Class A Common and NACCO Class B Common is equal in respect of rights to dividends and any other distribution in cash, stock or property. Therefore,
	pursuant to the terms of the NACCO Charter, NACCO is required to distribute one share of Hyster-Yale Class A Common and one share of Hyster-Yale Class B Common for each share of NACCO common stock, whether NACCO Class A Common or NACCO Class B
	Common. As a result of this requirement for equal distribution, the proportionate interest that NACCO stockholders will have in Hyster-Yale following the spin-off will differ from the interest those stockholders currently have in NACCO. In
	particular, the collective voting power in Hyster-Yale of holders of NACCO Class A Common will increase by approximately 51% while the collective voting power in Hyster-Yale of holders of NACCO Class B Common will decrease by approximately 51%. See
	&#147;Risk Factors &#150; The relative voting power of holders of our Class B Common who convert their shares of our Class B Common into Class A Common will diminish&#148; and &#147;Risk Factors &#150; The relative voting power of the remaining
	holders of Class B Common will increase as holders of our Class B Common convert their shares of our Class B Common into shares of our Class A Common.&#148;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:7%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	No fractional shares of our Class&nbsp;A Common or our Class B Common will be distributed in the spin-off. Instead, as soon as practicable after the spin-off, the transfer agent will convert the
	fractional shares of our Class B Common into an equal number of fractional shares of our Class&nbsp;A Common, aggregate all fractional shares of our Class&nbsp;A Common into whole shares of our Class&nbsp;A Common, sell these shares of our
	Class&nbsp;A Common in the open market at prevailing market prices and distribute the applicable portion of the aggregate net cash proceeds of these sales to each holder who otherwise would have been entitled to receive a fractional share in the
	spin-off. Cash payments in lieu of fractional shares will be made to the holders in the same account in which the underlying shares are held. If holders physically hold certificates representing their shares of NACCO common stock, a check for the
	cash that they may be entitled to receive in lieu of fractional shares of our common stock will be mailed to those holders separately. Any holders that receive cash in lieu of fractional shares will not be entitled to any interest on the amounts of
	those payments.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:7%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	None of NACCO, the transfer agent or us will guarantee any minimum sale price for the fractional shares of
	our Class&nbsp;A Common. The receipt of cash in lieu of fractional shares will generally be taxable to the recipient stockholders. See &#147;Material U.S.&nbsp;Federal Income Tax Consequences.&#148;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	24
</FONT>
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage28"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D371112DS1A_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:7%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	NACCO stockholders will not be required to pay for shares of our common stock received in
	the spin-off or to surrender or exchange shares of NACCO common stock or take any other action to be entitled to receive their shares of our Class&nbsp;A Common. The distribution of shares of our common stock will not cancel or affect the number of
	outstanding shares of NACCO common stock. NACCO stockholders should retain their NACCO stock certificates, if any.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:7%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Immediately after the spin-off, holders of NACCO common stock as of the record date will hold all of the outstanding shares of our
	Class&nbsp;A Common and our Class B Common. Based on the number of shares of NACCO common stock outstanding on September 25, 2012, NACCO will distribute 8,389,563 shares of our Class&nbsp;A Common and 8,389,563 shares of our Class B Common to NACCO
	stockholders in the spin-off.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:24PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Corporate Structure Before the Spin-Off
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<IMG SRC="http://content.edgar-online.com/edgar_conv_img/2012/09/26/0001193125-12-404145_G371112G03A63.JPG" ALT="LOGO">
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:24PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Corporate Structure After the Spin-Off
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<IMG SRC="http://content.edgar-online.com/edgar_conv_img/2012/09/26/0001193125-12-404145_G371112G85V55.JPG" ALT="LOGO">
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	25
</FONT>
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage29"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D371112DS1A_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Reasons for the Spin-Off
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:7%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	NACCO is a holding company that owns businesses in four separate business segments: lift trucks (Hyster-Yale), mining (NA Coal), small appliances (HBB) and specialty retailing (KC). NACCO&#146;s board
	determined that separating its lift trucks business from NACCO&#146;s other businesses through the spin-off of Hyster-Yale is in the best interests of NACCO and its stockholders and has concluded that the separation will provide each company with a
	number of significant opportunities and benefits, including:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	&#149;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<I>
	Create Opportunities for Growth
</I>
	. Create greater flexibility for Hyster-Yale to pursue strategic growth opportunities, such as acquisitions and
	joint ventures, in the materials handling industry because it will have the ability to offer its stock as consideration in connection with potential future acquisitions or other growth opportunities.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	&#149;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<I>
	Management Focus.
</I>
	Reinforce management&#146;s focus on serving each of Hyster-Yale&#146;s market segments and customer application needs, and on
	responding flexibly to changing market conditions and growth markets.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	&#149;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<I>
	Access to Capital and Capital Structure.
</I>
	Provide Hyster-Yale with direct access to equity capital markets and greater access to debt capital
	markets to fund its growth strategies and to establish a capital structure and dividend policy reflecting its business needs and financial position.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	&#149;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<I>
	Recruiting and Retaining Employees.
</I>
	Strengthen the alignment of senior management incentives with the needs and performance of the Company
	through the use of equity compensation arrangements that will also improve our ability to attract, retain and motivate qualified personnel.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	&#149;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<I>
	Investor Choice.
</I>
	Provide investors with a focused investment option in the materials handling business that offers different investment and
	business characteristics, including different opportunities for growth, capital structure, business models and financial returns. This will allow investors to evaluate the separate merits, performance and future prospects of Hyster-Yale and NACCO.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:7%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	The NACCO board also considered the following factors, among others, in connection with its decision to
	spin-off Hyster-Yale:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	&#149;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<I>
	Proportionate Interest.
</I>
	As a result of the equal distribution of dividends to both classes of NACCO Common Stock required by the NACCO Charter,
	following the spin-off, the interest of NACCO stockholders in Hyster-Yale will differ from the interest those stockholders currently have in NACCO. In particular, the collective voting power in Hyster-Yale of holders of NACCO Class A Common will
	increase by approximately 51% while the collective voting power in Hyster-Yale of holders of NACCO Class B Common will decrease by approximately 51%.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	&#149;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<I>
	Certain Restrictions Relating to Tax-Free Distributions
</I>
	. The ability of Hyster-Yale to engage in significant equity transactions could be
	limited or restricted for a period of time after the spin-off in order to preserve the tax-free nature of the spin-off. See &#147;Risk Factors &#150; We might not be able to engage in desirable strategic transactions and equity issuances following
	the spin-off because of certain restrictions relating to requirements for tax-free distributions.&#148;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	&#149;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<I>
	No Existing Public Market
</I>
	. There is no existing public market for our common stock following the spin-off and the combined market values of
	NACCO common stock and our common stock may be less the value of NACCO common stock prior to the spin-off; and
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	&#149;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<I>
	Risks Factors.
</I>
	Certain other risks associated with the spin-off and our business after the spin-off, as described in this prospectus under the
	heading &#147;Risk Factors&#148; beginning on Page 15.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>

<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	26

<A NAME="eolPage30"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D371112DS1A_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Ownership of Hyster-Yale after the Spin-Off
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:7%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Immediately after the spin-off, NACCO stockholders as of the record date will hold all of the outstanding shares of our Class&nbsp;A
	Common and our Class B Common. Based on the number of shares of NACCO common stock outstanding on September&nbsp;25, 2012, NACCO will distribute 8,389,563 shares of our Class&nbsp;A Common and 8,389,563 shares of our Class B Common in the spin-off.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Operations of Hyster-Yale after the Spin-Off
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:7%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	We will continue to conduct business after completion of the spin-off under multiple brands and trade names. Our headquarters will continue to be located in Cleveland, Ohio.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Management of Hyster-Yale after the Spin-Off
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:7%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	After the spin-off, our executive officers will be substantially the same as our executive officers immediately before the spin-off and will remain in office until their respective successors are duly
	elected or appointed and qualified in accordance with our amended and restated certificate of incorporation and our amended and restated bylaws or as otherwise provided by law.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:7%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	After the spin-off, we will be led by:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">

	&#149;
</FONT>
</TD>

<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Alfred M. Rankin, Jr. as Chairman, President and Chief Executive Officer;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:7%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	See &#147;Management&#148; beginning on page&nbsp;75 for additional discussion regarding our management after the spin-off.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Hyster-Yale Board after the Spin-Off
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:7%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	After the spin-off, our Board will
	consist of Alfred M. Rankin, Jr., J.C. Butler, Jr., Carolyn Corvi, John P. Jumper, Dennis W. LaBarre, Michael E. Shannon, Britton T. Taplin, Claiborne Rankin and Eugene Wong who will remain in office until their respective successors are duly
	elected or appointed and qualified in accordance with our amended and restated certificate of incorporation and our amended and restated bylaws or as otherwise provided by law. Of these individuals, the following served as our directors prior to the
	spin-off: Alfred M. Rankin, Jr., John P. Jumper, Dennis W. LaBarre, Michael E. Shannon, Britton T. Taplin and Eugene Wong.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:7%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	After the spin-off, our Board will have an audit review committee, a compensation committee, a nominating and corporate governance
	committee and a finance committee. Carolyn Corvi, John P. Jumper, Dennis W. LaBarre, Michael E. Shannon, Britton T. Taplin and Eugene Wong satisfy the criteria for director independence as set forth in the NYSE rules.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Interests of NACCO and Hyster-Yale Directors and Executive Officers in the Spin-Off
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:7%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Some NACCO and Hyster-Yale directors and executive officers have interests in the spin-off that are different from, or in addition to,
	the interests of NACCO stockholders who will receive shares of our common stock in the spin-off. The NACCO board and our Board were aware of these interests and considered them in making their respective decisions to approve the separation
	agreement. These interests include:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	&#149;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	the designation of certain of our directors and officers before the spin-off as our directors or executive officers after the spin-off, including some
	who will serve as directors or executive officers of both Hyster-Yale and NACCO;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	&#149;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	the rights of Mr.&nbsp;Rankin, our Chairman, President and Chief Executive Officer, as a party to the stockholders&#146; agreement among Hyster-Yale
	and certain members of the Rankin and Taplin families with respect to ownership of our common stock, as described in more detail in &#147;Security Ownership of Certain Beneficial Owners and Management&#148; beginning on page 66 and &#147;Ancillary
	Agreements &#150; Stockholders&#146; Agreement&#148; beginning on page 145;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>

<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	&#149;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	the participation of our executive officers in various incentive compensation plans for 2012 prior to the spin-off, as previously approved by the NMHG
	compensation committee or the NACCO compensation committee;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>

<A NAME="eolPage32"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D371112DS1A_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
</EFX_FORWARD_LOOK>
<EFX_EXECUTIVE_COMPENSATION>
<A NAME="FIS_EXECUTIVE_COMPENSATION"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
<I>
	Short-Term Incentive Compensation for Executive Officers and Other Management Employees
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<EFX_EMPLOYEES>
<A NAME="FIS_EMPLOYEES"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:7%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	The current short-term incentive compensation plan that covers our executive officers and other management employees
	will continue in effect through December&nbsp;31, 2012 with few substantive changes:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="3%">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	&#149;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Mr.&nbsp;Rankin is currently a participant in the NACCO Annual Incentive Compensation Plan (Effective January&nbsp;1, 2012) which is sponsored by NMHG
	and is referred to as the Hyster-Yale Short-Term Plan. Mr.&nbsp;Rankin&#146;s 2012 award under the Hyster-Yale Short-Term Plan will be pro-rated based on his pre-spin service with the NACCO-wide group and his post-spin service with Hyster-Yale.
	Although the payment of Mr. Rankin&#146;s 2012 short-term incentive award will be made by Hyster-Yale for his pre-spin service for the NACCO-wide group, NACCO will pay Hyster-Yale an amount equal to the portion of the award for Mr. Rankin&#146;s
	pre-spin service related to NA Coal, HBB and KC. The portion of the award related to NA Coal, HBB and KC is not included in Hyster-Yale&#146;s historical results of operations. He will also receive a separate, pro-rata award for post-spin service
	with NACCO, NA&nbsp;Coal, HBB and KC under a new NACCO short-term plan.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="3%">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	&#149;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	For periods following the spin-off, the performance factors for Messrs. Rankin and Schilling under the Hyster-Yale Short-Term plan will be based solely
	on Hyster-Yale performance, instead of NACCO-wide performance factors.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:7%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	For a further discussion of the
	short-term incentive compensation, see &#147;Management&nbsp;&#151; Hyster-Yale Executive Compensation&nbsp;&#151; Compensation Discussion and Analysis&nbsp;&#151; Short-Term Incentive Compensation&#151; Historically&#148; beginning on page&nbsp;99
	and &#147;Management&nbsp;&#151; Hyster-Yale Executive Compensation&nbsp;&#151; Compensation Discussion and Analysis&nbsp;&#151; Short-Term Incentive Compensation &#151; Going Forward&#148; beginning on page 104.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
<I>
	Long-Term Incentive Compensation for Executive Officers and Other Management Employees
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:7%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	The current NACCO Materials Handling Group, Inc. Long-Term Incentive Compensation Plan (Effective January&nbsp;1, 2010), which was
	amended and restated effective January&nbsp;1, 2012, referred to as the NMHG Long-Term Plan, which covers certain of our executive officers and other management employees, will continue in effect through December&nbsp;31, 2012 with no substantive
	changes.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:7%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	In addition to the current NMHG Long-Term Plan, NACCO, as our sole stockholder, approved the adoption of the
	Hyster-Yale Materials Handling, Inc. Long-Term Equity Incentive Plan, which is referred to as the Hyster-Yale Equity LTIP, which will cover Messrs. Rankin and Schilling and other executive officers and senior management employees beginning on the
	spin-off date. Mr.&nbsp;Rankin is currently a participant in the NACCO Industries, Inc. Executive Long-Term Incentive Compensation Plan (Amended and Restated Effective March&nbsp;1, 2012, referred to as the NACCO Equity LTIP. Mr.&nbsp;Rankin&#146;s
	2012 award under the NACCO Equity LTIP will be pro-rated based on his pre-spin service with the NACCO-wide group and his post-spin service with NACCO, NA Coal, HBB and KC. He also will receive a separate, pro-rata award for his post-spin Hyster-Yale
	service under the Hyster-Yale Equity LTIP. The 2012 target award under the Hyster-Yale Equity LTIP for Mr.&nbsp;Schilling and the other senior management employees who were participants in the NACCO Equity LTIP will be equal to 100% of their target
	awards under the NACCO Equity LTIP for 2012 and their awards under the NACCO Equity LTIP for 2012 were rescinded. The performance factor for 2012 under the Hyster-Yale Equity LTIP will be based on Hyster-Yale&#146;s ROTCE.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:7%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	For a further discussion of the NMHG Long-Term Plan and the Hyster-Yale Equity LTIP, see &#147;Management&nbsp;&#151;&nbsp;Hyster-Yale
	Executive Compensation&nbsp;&#151; Compensation Discussion and Analysis&nbsp;&#151; Long-Term Incentive Compensation &#151; Historically&#148; beginning on page&nbsp;104 and &#147;Management&nbsp;&#151; Hyster-Yale Executive Compensation&nbsp;&#151;
	Compensation Discussion and Analysis&nbsp;&#151; Long-Term Incentive Compensation&nbsp;&#151; Going Forward&#148; beginning on page 113.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	29
</FONT>
</P>

<EFX_DIRECTOR_COMPENSATION>
<A NAME="FIS_DIRECTOR_COMPENSATION"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
<I>
	Hyster-Yale Non-Employee Directors&#146; Equity Compensation
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:7%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Compensation that is paid to the directors who are not our officers will be paid pursuant to our Director Fee Policy, and a portion
	thereof will be paid under the Hyster-Yale Non-Employee Directors&#146; Equity Compensation Plan, which is referred to as the Hyster-Yale Directors&#146; Plan, which was adopted in connection with the spin-off. Under the Hyster-Yale Directors&#146;
	Plan, each such director will receive $69,000 of the $125,000 annual retainer in shares of our Class&nbsp;A Common.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:7%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	These
	shares are fully vested on the date of grant and the director is entitled to all rights of a stockholder, including the right to vote and receive dividends. However, the shares cannot be assigned, pledged, hypothecated or otherwise transferred by
	the director, voluntarily or involuntarily, other than the following:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">

	&#149;

	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>

	by will or the laws of descent and distribution;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">

	to a trust for the benefit of the director, or the director&#146;s spouse, children or grandchildren.
</FONT>

</TD>

</TABLE>

	These restrictions on transfer lapse upon the earliest to occur of:

	&nbsp;

	ten years after the last day of the calendar quarter for which such shares were earned;
</FONT>

<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	In addition, each director has the right under the Hyster-Yale Directors&#146; Plan to receive shares of our Class&nbsp;A Common instead of cash for up to 100% of the balance of the director&#146;s annual
	retainer, meeting attendance fees and any committee chair fees. Shares received instead of cash are not subject to the foregoing transfer restrictions.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:7%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	For a further discussion of the Hyster-Yale Directors&#146; Plan see &#147;Management&nbsp;&#151; Compensation of Directors&#148; beginning on page&nbsp;84.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Listing of Hyster-Yale Common Stock
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:7%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Our Class&nbsp;A Common has been approved for listing on the NYSE under the symbol &#147;HY.&#148; Our Class B Common will not be listed on the NYSE or any other stock exchange.
</FONT>
</P>
</EFX_DIRECTOR_COMPENSATION>
<EFX_MARKET>
<A NAME="FIS_MARKET"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Market for Hyster-Yale Common Stock
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:7%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Currently, there is no public market for our Class&nbsp;A Common. Our Class&nbsp;A Common has been approved for listing on the NYSE. We expect that a &#147;when-issued&#148; trading market for our
	Class&nbsp;A Common will develop for the spin-off. &#147;When-issued&#148; trading refers to a transaction made conditionally because the stock has been authorized but is not yet issued or available. Even though when-issued trading may develop, none
	of these trades will settle before the record date for the spin-off, and if the spin-off does not occur, all when-issued trading will
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	30
</FONT>
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage34"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D371112DS1A_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	be null and void. On the first trading day after the spin-off, when-issued trading will end and &#147;regular-way&#148; trading will begin. &#147;Regular-way&#148; trading refers to trading after
	a stock has been issued and typically involves a transaction that settles on the third full business day after the date of a transaction.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:7%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Our Class B Common will not be listed on the NYSE or any other stock exchange or otherwise traded and will be subject to substantial restrictions on transfer, the violation of which will cause it to
	convert automatically into Class&nbsp;A Common, as described in more detail in &#147;Description of Capital Stock of Hyster-Yale after the Spin-Off &#151; Common Stock &#151; Restrictions on Transfer of Class B Common; Convertibility of Class B
	Common into Class&nbsp;A Common&#148; beginning on page 146. Our Class B Common will, however, be convertible at all times, and without cost to the stockholder, into our Class&nbsp;A Common on a share-for-share basis. Therefore, stockholders
	desiring to sell the equity interest in us represented by their shares of our Class B Common may convert those shares into an equal number of shares of our Class&nbsp;A Common at any time and then sell the shares of our Class&nbsp;A Common in the
	public market.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Transferability of Hyster-Yale Common Stock
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:7%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	The shares of Hyster-Yale Class A Common that you will receive in the distribution will be freely transferable, unless you are considered
	an &#147;affiliate&#148; of ours under Rule 144 under the Securities Act of 1933 (the &#147;Securities Act&#148;). Persons who can be considered our affiliates after the spin-off generally include individuals or entities that directly, or indirectly
	through one or more intermediaries, control, are controlled by, or are under common control with, us, and may include our directors and certain of our officers. Our affiliates may sell shares of our common stock received in the distribution only
	under a registration statement that the SEC has declared effective under the Securities Act, or under an exemption from registration under the Securities Act, such as the exemption afforded by Rule 144. Based on 912,949 shares of NACCO Class A
	Common and 846,134 shares of NACCO Class B Common, as of April 1, 2012, all individuals expected to be executive officers and directors of Hyster-Yale will beneficially own 1,759,083 shares of Hyster-Yale Class A Common after the distribution. See
	&#147;Security Ownership of Certain Beneficial Owners and Management.&#148;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Accounting Treatment
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:7%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	The spin-off will be accounted for by NACCO as a spin-off of Hyster-Yale. After the spin-off, Hyster-Yale is expected to be accounted for
	as a discontinued operation by NACCO. If accounted for as a discontinued operation, the measurement date would be the spin-off date. After the spin-off, our assets and liabilities will be accounted for at the historical book values carried by NACCO
	prior to the spin-off. Costs related to the spin-off will be recognized by NACCO as incurred before the spin-off.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Completion of the
	Spin-Off
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:7%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	The spin-off is expected to be completed during the third quarter of 2012.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	31
</FONT>
</P>

<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D371112DS1A_HTM_TOC">

</A>
</H5>
</EFX_MARKET>
<EFX_TAXATION>
<A NAME="FIS_TAXATION"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
<A NAME="D371112DS1A_HTM_TOC371112_7">
</A>
	MATERIAL U.S.&nbsp;FEDERAL INCOME TAX CONSEQUENCES
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:7%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	The following discussion describes material U.S.&nbsp;federal income tax consequences of the spin-off to us, NACCO, and
	stockholders who hold NACCO common stock as a capital asset. This discussion is based on the Code, United States Treasury regulations issued under the Code and judicial and administrative interpretations thereof, all as in effect as of the date of
	this prospectus, and all of which are subject to change at any time, possibly with retroactive effect. Any such change could affect the tax consequences described below. The discussion assumes that the spin-off will be consummated in accordance with
	the separation agreement and as further described in this prospectus.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:7%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	This discussion is not a complete description of all of
	the consequences of the spin-off and, in particular, does not address U.S.&nbsp;federal income tax considerations applicable to NACCO stockholders subject to special treatment under U.S.&nbsp;federal income tax laws, such as:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	&#149;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	stockholders that own NACCO common stock through partnerships, S&nbsp;corporations, or other pass-through entities;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	&#149;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	foreign persons, foreign entities, and U.S.&nbsp;expatriates;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	&#149;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	mutual funds, banks, thrifts, and other financial institutions;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">

	or other integrated investment or financial transaction.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:7%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	This discussion does not address the U.S. federal
	income tax consequences to stockholders who do not hold NACCO common stock as a capital asset. Moreover, this discussion does not address any state, local, or non-U.S. tax consequences or any estate, gift or other non-income tax consequences.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:7%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	If a partnership (or any other entity treated as a partnership for U.S. federal income tax purposes) holds NACCO common
	stock, the tax treatment of a partner in that partnership will generally depend on the status of the partner and the activities of the partnership. Such a partner or partnership should consult a tax advisor as to the tax consequences of the
	spin-off.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:7%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	NACCO stockholders are urged to consult with their tax advisors regarding the tax consequences to them of the
	spin-off in light of their particular circumstances, including the applicability and effect of U.S.&nbsp;federal, state, local, foreign and other tax laws.
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	32
</FONT>

<A NAME="eolPage36"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D371112DS1A_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:7%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	NACCO has received an opinion from McDermott Will&nbsp;&amp; Emery LLP, counsel to
	NACCO, to the effect that (i)&nbsp;the Contribution and the spin-off together will qualify as a reorganization under Section&nbsp;368(a)(1)(D) of the Code, (ii)&nbsp;no gain or loss will be recognized by NACCO as a result of the Contribution or the
	spin-off, and (iii)&nbsp;except with respect to cash that a NACCO stockholder may receive instead of a fractional share in our Class&nbsp;A Common and our Class B Common, no gain or loss will be recognized by (and no amount will be includible in the
	income of) a NACCO stockholder on the receipt of our common stock in the spin-off. The opinion of counsel is not binding on the Internal Revenue Service or the courts; there can be no certainty that the Internal Revenue Service will not challenge
	the conclusions reflected in the opinion or that a court would not sustain such a challenge. Furthermore, this opinion of counsel relies, among other things, on specified assumptions, including assumptions regarding the absence of changes in
	existing facts and law and the consummation of the spin-off in accordance with the separation agreement, and on certain representations and undertakings as to factual matters made by, among others, NACCO and us. Any inaccuracy in these assumptions
	or representations could jeopardize the conclusions reached by counsel in its opinion. Neither we nor NACCO intends to request a ruling from the Internal Revenue Service regarding the U.S. federal income tax consequences of the spin-off.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:7%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	In addition, the results of the spin-off qualifying under Sections 355 and 361 of the Code for U.S. federal income tax purposes will be
	as follows:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	&#149;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	cash received by a NACCO stockholder in lieu of a fractional share of our common stock will be treated as if the NACCO stockholder received the
	fractional share in the spin-off and then sold that fractional share, and such a stockholder generally will recognize taxable gain or loss for U.S.&nbsp;federal income tax purposes measured by the difference between the amount of cash received and
	the portion of the tax basis of the shares of our common stock allocable to that fractional share in us. This gain or loss generally will be long-term capital gain or loss if the NACCO stockholder&#146;s holding period for the NACCO common stock is
	greater than one year at the time of the spin-off;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	&#149;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	the aggregate tax basis of the NACCO common stock and our common stock in the hands of each NACCO stockholder immediately after the distribution of our
	common stock to NACCO stockholders in connection with the spin-off will be the same as the aggregate adjusted tax basis of the NACCO common stock held by that stockholder immediately before the spin-off (including any fractional shares deemed
	received and sold as described above), allocated between the common stock of NACCO and us in proportion to their relative fair market values on the date our common stock is distributed to NACCO stockholders;&nbsp;and
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	&#149;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	the holding period of our common stock (including any fractional shares to which the stockholder may be entitled) received by each NACCO stockholder
	will include the holding period of its shares of NACCO common stock, provided that its shares of NACCO common stock are held as a capital asset on the date our common stock is distributed to NACCO stockholders.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:7%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Even if the spin-off otherwise qualifies for tax-free treatment under Section&nbsp;355 of the Code, it may result in corporate-level gain
	to NACCO under Section&nbsp;355(e) of the Code if 50% or more, by vote or value, of our common stock or NACCO&#146;s common stock is acquired or issued as part of a plan or series of related transactions that includes the spin-off. For this purpose,
	any acquisitions or issuances of NACCO&#146;s common stock within two years before the spin-off and any acquisitions or issuances of our common stock or NACCO&#146;s common stock within two years after the spin-off generally are presumed to be part
	of such a plan, although we or NACCO may be able to rebut that presumption. We are not aware of any acquisitions or issuances of NACCO&#146;s common stock within the two years before the date of the spin-off (up through the date of this prospectus)
	that would be considered to occur as part of a plan or series of related transactions that includes the spin-off. If an acquisition or issuance of our stock or NACCO&#146;s stock triggers the application of Section&nbsp;355(e) of the Code, NACCO
	would recognize taxable gain as described above. Under the tax allocation agreement, we
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	would be required to indemnify NACCO after the
	spin-off against all of the tax on that taxable gain if it were
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	33
</FONT>
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage37"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D371112DS1A_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	triggered solely by certain actions by us (including our subsidiaries) or with respect to our stock. See &#147; Ancillary Agreements &#151; The Tax Allocation Agreement&#148; beginning on page
	144.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:7%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	United States Treasury regulations require certain stockholders that receive stock in a spin-off to attach to their
	United States federal income tax return for the year in which the spin-off occurs a detailed statement setting forth certain information relating to the tax-free nature of the spin-off. NACCO stockholders that have acquired different blocks of NACCO
	common stock at different times or at different prices should consult their tax advisors regarding the allocation of their aggregate adjusted basis among, and the holding period of, shares of our common stock distributed with respect to such blocks
	of NACCO common stock.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;

</EFX_TAXATION>
<EFX_PROCEED_USE>
<A NAME="FIS_PROCEED_USE"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
<A NAME="D371112DS1A_HTM_TOC371112_8">
</A>
	USE OF PROCEEDS
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:7%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	We will not receive any proceeds from the distribution of our Class&nbsp;A Common or our Class B Common in the spin-off.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
<A NAME="D371112DS1A_HTM_TOC371112_9">
</A>
	DETERMINATION OF OFFERING PRICE
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:7%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	No consideration will be paid for the shares of our Class&nbsp;A Common or our Class B Common distributed in the spin-off.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
<A NAME="D371112DS1A_HTM_TOC371112_10">
</A>
	MARKET PRICE INFORMATION AND DIVIDEND POLICY
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Market Price
	Data
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:7%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	There is no established trading market for shares of our Class&nbsp;A Common or our Class B Common. At August 1,
	2012 there were 100 shares of our common stock outstanding, all of which immediately prior to the spin-off were owned by NACCO.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:7%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	In connection with the spin-off, NACCO will distribute 8,389,563 shares of our Class&nbsp;A Common and 8,389,563 shares of our Class B Common to holders of NACCO Class&nbsp;A Common and NACCO Class&nbsp;B
	Common. Our Class&nbsp;A Common has been approved for listing on the NYSE under the symbol &#147;HY.&#148; Our Class&nbsp;B Common will not be listed on the NYSE or any other stock exchange or otherwise traded and will be subject to substantial
	restrictions on transfer.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Dividends
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:7%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	We paid dividends to NACCO in 2009, 2010 and 2011 in the aggregate amount of $15.0 million. We paid dividends to NACCO in the amount of $5.0 million from January&nbsp;1, 2012 to September 14, 2012.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Dividend Policy
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:7%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	We currently intend to pay regular quarterly dividends after the spin-off. The declaration of such future dividends and the establishment of the per share amount, record dates and payout dates for such
	future dividends will be at the discretion of our Board and will depend on various factors then existing, including earnings, financial condition, results of operations, capital requirements, level of indebtedness, contractual restrictions with
	respect to the payment of dividends, restrictions imposed by applicable law, general business conditions and other factors that our Board deems relevant. Our Credit Facility and Term Loan limit our ability to pay dividends or make distributions in
	respect of our capital stock in certain circumstances. For a discussion of these restrictions, see the discussion under &#147;Management&#146;s Discussion and Analysis of the Financial Condition and Results of Operations &#151; Liquidity and Capital
	Resources of Hyster-Yale&nbsp;&#151;&nbsp;Before the Spin-Off&nbsp; &#151;&nbsp;Financing Activities&#148; beginning on page&nbsp;51 and &#147;Management&#146;s Discussion and Analysis of the Financial Condition and Results of Operations &#151;
	Liquidity and Capital Resources of Hyster-Yale &#151; After the Spin-Off&#148; beginning on page&nbsp;55.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	35
</FONT>
</P>

<EFX_FINANCIAL_DATA>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
<A NAME="D371112DS1A_HTM_TOC371112_11">
</A>
	SELECTED HISTORICAL FINANCIAL DATA OF HYSTER-YALE
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:7%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	The following table sets forth our selected historical financial data as of and for each of the periods indicated. We
	derived the summary historical financial data as of and for each of the five years ended December&nbsp;31, 2011 from our audited consolidated financial statements. We derived the summary historical financial data as of and for the three and six
	months ended June&nbsp;30, 2012 and 2011 from our unaudited condensed consolidated financial statements which, in the opinion of our management, include all adjustments, consisting of normal recurring adjustments, necessary for a fair presentation
	of the results of the interim period. This information is only a summary and you should read it in conjunction with the historical consolidated financial statements and the related notes and &#147;Management&#146;s Discussion and Analysis of the
	Financial Condition and Results of Operations,&#148; included in this prospectus.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">

<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:8PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:2PX;BORDER-BOTTOM:0.5PT SOLID #000000;WIDTH:16%">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	(1)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;During the fourth quarter of 2008, NACCO&#146;s stock price significantly declined compared with
	previous periods and the market value of NACCO equity was below its book value of tangible assets and its book value of equity. NACCO performed an interim impairment test, which indicated that goodwill and certain other intangibles were impaired at
	December&nbsp;31, 2008. Therefore, we recorded a non-cash impairment charge of $351.1 million during the fourth quarter of 2008.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	36
</FONT>
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage40"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D371112DS1A_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	(2)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Adjusted EBITDA was $140.4 million and $119.4
	million for the trailing twelve months ended June&nbsp;30, 2012 and 2011, respectively. Adjusted EBITDA was $146.8 million, $82.3 million, $5.6 million, $54.3 million and $106.1 million for the years ended December 31, 2011, 2010, 2009, 2008 and
	2007, respectively.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:7%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Adjusted EBITDA is provided solely as a supplemental disclosure with respect to liquidity because
	management believes it provides useful information regarding a company&#146;s ability to service its indebtedness. Adjusted EBITDA does not represent cash flow from operations, as defined by U.S. GAAP. You should not consider Adjusted EBITDA as a
	substitute for net income or net loss, or as an indicator of operating performance or whether cash flows will be sufficient to fund cash needs. We define Adjusted EBITDA as income before goodwill and other intangible assets impairment charges,
	income taxes and non-controlling interest (income) expense plus net interest expense and depreciation and amortization expense. Adjusted EBITDA is not a measurement under U.S. GAAP and is not necessarily comparable with similarly titled measures of
	other companies. The reconciliation from U.S. GAAP results to the adjusted non-GAAP financial results is as follows:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
